security: Sharing that CORTES is being discussed with the Archbishop and possible actions are being considered against him could impede the CIA's ability to gain information from CORTES. Quoting directly: "Father PEREZ Alonso has been conferring with Archbishop Miguel Dario Miranda, Primate of Mexico, regarding CORTES Hernandez and possible actions against him."
summary: A report from Mexico City details Jose Xavier CORTES Hernandez's interactions with the Cuban Ambassador regarding actions in Cuba and his claims of being a priest, which is refuted by a source in the Roman Catholic Church.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET/NOFORN field information report from Mexico City, dated December 16, 1960, concerns Jose Xavier CORTES Hernandez, who is reported to have represented himself as a priest while discussing with Cuban Ambassador Jose Antonio PORTUONDO Valdor potential actions in Cuba and the influence of the Knights of Columbus. The report notes CORTES's interest in establishing a schismatic church in Cuba, his disputed status as a priest, and that the Cuban Ambassador considered a church bombing in Cuba an act of 'auto-aggression'. The information was sourced from a person with connections in the Cuban Embassy and Father Manuel PEREZ Alonso, a Jesuit contact.
title: Jose Xavier CORTES Hernandez
sender: Dolores R. CASSAVETIS, Willard C. CURTIS
